meanings.sent1: The unloose of the bird from its cage brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent2: The unloose of the prisoner was a moment of freedom after years of captivity.
meanings.sent3: The unloose of the balloon made the birthday party even more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the unloose of a dam, flooding the room with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The unloose of the dog's leash symbolized the start of a new adventure.

meanings.definition: To free from a fastening or bond.
meanings.sent1: He managed to unloose the knot with a quick tug.
meanings.sent2: The hero had to unloose the chains to escape from the dungeon.
meanings.sent3: She had to unloose her grip on the rope to catch the falling object.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to unloose himself from the handcuffs effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The key was the only way to unloose the lock and open the treasure chest.

meanings.sent1: After a long day, she liked to unloose her muscles with a warm bath.
meanings.sent2: The soothing music helped him unloose his tension and fall asleep.
meanings.sent3: The gentle massage was the perfect way to unloose after a stressful week.
meanings.sent4: The yoga class helped her unloose both body and mind.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze seemed to unloose the tight knot of worries in his mind.
